page.title: 10SOCIAL LIFE OF A HOUSEWIFE?
page.content: The housewife I interviewed had little time for a social life.Any spare time she had was used for shopping in her local village of Birkdale,making clothes,or preparing special meals for her husband's business clients. Occasionally in the evening she watched television and treated herself with a large bar of chocolate.She did not think she should be paid for her work because she did it for the love of her children and her husband. Her feelings about the 1980's were mixed.Her bad feelings were due to drug abuse,hooligans and a generally casual attitude on the part of many people.To cope with these problems,she believed there should be stronger punishments so that offenders learned to conform.She was grateful for money raised for charity and science and technology,both medical and industrial
